bug.author: morsik
bug.summary: [Bug] Crash in the middle of separation
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>Description</denchmark-h>
Spleeter crashes in the middle of separation process. At the output directory I've got only part of vocals.wav. <denchmark-h:h2>Step to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Just install clean Spleeter 1.5.0 <denchmark-code>$ conda list | grep spleeter # packages in environment at /home/morsik/.conda/envs/spleeter: spleeter 1.5.0 py37hc8dfbb8_0 conda-forge </denchmark-code>
Installed using conda install -c conda-forge spleeter Run as spleeter separate -i ~/Ayreon\ -\ Intergalactic\ Space\ Crusaders\ \(Universe\)-mDjomu33Xzc.webm spleeter:2stems -o output Got error below.
This is file downloaded from YouTube so I tried reinstalling whole Conda environment (just removed ~/.conda/envs/spleeter and recreated it from scratch along with removing pretrained_models directory to force redownload models) because maybe of some bug. After not fixing this by all of this I tried file that I had previously splitted by Spleeter 1.0 right after release - and it crashed too. <denchmark-h:h2>Output</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>INFO:spleeter:Downloading model archive https://github.com/deezer/spleeter/releases/download/v1.4.0/2stems.tar.gz INFO:spleeter:Validating archive checksum INFO:spleeter:Extracting downloaded 2stems archive INFO:spleeter:2stems model file(s) extracted OMP: Info #212: KMP_AFFINITY: decoding x2APIC ids. OMP: Info #210: KMP_AFFINITY: Affinity capable, using global cpuid leaf 11 info OMP: Info #154: KMP_AFFINITY: Initial OS proc set respected: 0-7 OMP: Info #156: KMP_AFFINITY: 8 available OS procs OMP: Info #157: KMP_AFFINITY: Uniform topology OMP: Info #179: KMP_AFFINITY: 1 packages x 4 cores/pkg x 2 threads/core (4 total cores) OMP: Info #214: KMP_AFFINITY: OS proc to physical thread map: OMP: Info #171: KMP_AFFINITY: OS proc 0 maps to package 0 core 0 thread 0 OMP: Info #171: KMP_AFFINITY: OS proc 4 maps to package 0 core 0 thread 1 OMP: Info #171: KMP_AFFINITY: OS proc 1 maps to package 0 core 1 thread 0 OMP: Info #171: KMP_AFFINITY: OS proc 5 maps to package 0 core 1 thread 1 OMP: Info #171: KMP_AFFINITY: OS proc 2 maps to package 0 core 2 thread 0 OMP: Info #171: KMP_AFFINITY: OS proc 6 maps to package 0 core 2 thread 1 OMP: Info #171: KMP_AFFINITY: OS proc 3 maps to package 0 core 3 thread 0 OMP: Info #171: KMP_AFFINITY: OS proc 7 maps to package 0 core 3 thread 1 OMP: Info #250: KMP_AFFINITY: pid 985669 tid 985669 thread 0 bound to OS proc set 0 OMP: Info #250: KMP_AFFINITY: pid 985669 tid 986165 thread 1 bound to OS proc set 1 OMP: Info #250: KMP_AFFINITY: pid 985669 tid 986164 thread 2 bound to OS proc set 2 OMP: Info #250: KMP_AFFINITY: pid 985669 tid 986203 thread 3 bound to OS proc set 3 OMP: Info #250: KMP_AFFINITY: pid 985669 tid 986205 thread 5 bound to OS proc set 5 OMP: Info #250: KMP_AFFINITY: pid 985669 tid 986204 thread 4 bound to OS proc set 4 OMP: Info #250: KMP_AFFINITY: pid 985669 tid 986206 thread 6 bound to OS proc set 6 OMP: Info #250: KMP_AFFINITY: pid 985669 tid 986207 thread 7 bound to OS proc set 7 OMP: Info #250: KMP_AFFINITY: pid 985669 tid 986208 thread 8 bound to OS proc set 0 OMP: Info #250: KMP_AFFINITY: pid 985669 tid 986216 thread 16 bound to OS proc set 0 OMP: Info #250: KMP_AFFINITY: pid 985669 tid 986210 thread 10 bound to OS proc set 2 OMP: Info #250: KMP_AFFINITY: pid 985669 tid 986209 thread 9 bound to OS proc set 1 OMP: Info #250: KMP_AFFINITY: pid 985669 tid 986212 thread 12 bound to OS proc set 4 OMP: Info #250: KMP_AFFINITY: pid 985669 tid 986215 thread 15 bound to OS proc set 7 OMP: Info #250: KMP_AFFINITY: pid 985669 tid 986213 thread 13 bound to OS proc set 5 OMP: Info #250: KMP_AFFINITY: pid 985669 tid 986211 thread 11 bound to OS proc set 3 OMP: Info #250: KMP_AFFINITY: pid 985669 tid 986214 thread 14 bound to OS proc set 6 ERROR:spleeter:An error occurs with ffprobe (see ffprobe output below)
ffprobe version 4.2 Copyright (c) 2007-2019 the FFmpeg developers built with gcc 7.3.0 (crosstool-NG 1.23.0.449-a04d0) configuration: --prefix=/home/morsik/.conda/envs/spleeter --cc=/home/conda/feedstock_root/build_artifacts/ffmpeg_1566210161358/_build_env/bin/x86_64-conda_cos6-linux-gnu-cc --disable-doc --disable-openssl --enable-avresample --enable-gnutls --enable-gpl --enable-hardcoded-tables --enable-libfreetype --enable-libopenh264 --enable-libx264 --enable-pic --enable-pthreads --enable-shared --enable-static --enable-version3 --enable-zlib --enable-libmp3lame libavutil 56. 31.100 / 56. 31.100 libavcodec 58. 54.100 / 58. 54.100 libavformat 58. 29.100 / 58. 29.100 libavdevice 58. 8.100 / 58. 8.100 libavfilter 7. 57.100 / 7. 57.100 libavresample 4. 0. 0 / 4. 0. 0 libswscale 5. 5.100 / 5. 5.100 libswresample 3. 5.100 / 3. 5.100 libpostproc 55. 5.100 / 55. 5.100 spleeter:2stems: Protocol not found
</denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
OS Fedora 31 with 5.5.13-200.fc31.x86_64
Installation type Conda
RAM available 16G + 32G SWAP
Hardware spec i7-8565U
<denchmark-h:h2>Additional context</denchmark-h>
Tried on <denchmark-link:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mDjomu33Xzc>this</denchmark-link> YouTube video, but also on mp3 file I previously had converted successfully. I've tried also setting -B tensorflow and -B librosa - both failed wth same error.

comments.comment: The command spleeter separate -i ~/Ayreon\ -\ Intergalactic\ Space\ Crusaders\ \(Universe\)-mDjomu33Xzc.webm spleeter:2stems -o output you're running is incorrect. It must be: spleeter separate -i ~/Ayreon\ -\ Intergalactic\ Space\ Crusaders\ \(Universe\)-mDjomu33Xzc.webm -p spleeter:2stems -o output (with an extra -pbefore spleeter:2stems) otherwise, spleeter:2stems is considered a second audio to be separated, and ffmpeg is not able to handle it, as stated by the lines ERROR:spleeter:An error occurs with ffprobe (see ffprobe output below) and spleeter:2stems: Protocol not found in the log.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/romi1502>@romi1502</denchmark-link> I feel so stupid nowâ€¦ I accidentally removed when using this command taken from my bash history and didn't compared to history. Thank you!
